Articles.Content:
I've got a contract that wants data from low solar orbit. If I'm going to take the time and energy to do that, I may as well send a full science package. But what altitude is the divider between low and high space over the Sun? And, what kind of heat management will I need?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-03T15:12:04Z" title="07/03/2015 03:12  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 3, 2015</time> by Barefoot Friar**

IIRC, low solar orbit is anything less than 1 million. Heat management, yeah, you need it for some parts. Check out the [Solar Limbo Challenge](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/124522-Solar-Limbo-How-Low-can-you-Go) thread for the experiences of others there so far. And if you're going there, might as well participate in the challenge.

To get the science you only have to get down to that altitude, you don't have to circularise your orbit down there (as they do in the limbo challenge). If your orbit is eccentric enough and just dips below the line at periapsis then you should get away with a lot less cooling.

Thanks for the info. And yeah, I've been looking at the challenge... I'll play around with it and see what I can do. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
